bill_title: Honoring Barbara Ohleen of Webster as South Dakota's 2003 Secondary Guidance Counselor of the Year.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring Barbara Ohleen of Webster as South Dakota's 2003 Secondary Guidance Counselor of the Year. WHEREAS, Barbara Ohleen, a guidance counselor at Webster High School and Roslyn High School, was chosen as the South Dakota Secondary Guidance Counselor of the Year; and WHEREAS, Mrs. Ohleen has spent the past eight years as the guidance counselor at Webster High School, and in addition to that, the past two years as guidance counselor at Roslyn High School and also serves as senior class advisor and National Honor Society advisor; and WHEREAS, Mrs. Ohleen believes in encouraging students to become responsible individuals, to accept the consequences of their decisions and actions, to accomplish their goals, and to be enthusiastic about learning and their future: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-ninth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Barbara Ohleen be congratulated upon her selection as South Dakota's 2003 Secondary Guidance Counselor of the Year.

A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring Barbara Ohleen of Webster as South Dakota's 2003 Secondary Guidance Counselor of the Year. WHEREAS, Barbara Ohleen, a guidance counselor at Webster High School and Roslyn High School, was chosen as the South Dakota Secondary Guidance Counselor of the Year; and WHEREAS, Mrs. Ohleen has spent the past eight years as the guidance counselor at Webster High School, and in addition to that, the past two years as guidance counselor at Roslyn High School and also serves as senior class advisor and National Honor Society advisor; and WHEREAS, Mrs. Ohleen believes in encouraging students to become responsible individuals, to accept the consequences of their decisions and actions, to accomplish their goals, and to be enthusiastic about learning and their future: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-ninth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Barbara Ohleen be congratulated upon her selection as South Dakota's 2003 Secondary Guidance Counselor of the Year.
